  • Method Details

    • canSkipAnimation

      public boolean canSkipAnimation()
      Description copied from class: AbstractStructure
      Checks if this structure can be opened instantly (i.e. skip the animation).

      This describes whether skipping the animation actually does anything. When a structure can skip its animation, it means that the actual toggle has an effect on the world and as such toggling it without an animation does something.

      Structures that do not have any effect other than their animation because all their blocks start and stop at exactly the same place (i.e. flags) cannot skip their animation because skipping the animation would mean removing the blocks of the structure from their locations and then placing them back at exactly the same position. This would be a waste of performance for both the server and the client and as such should be prevented.

      Overrides:
      canSkipAnimation in class AbstractStructure
      Returns:
      True, if this structure can skip its animation.

    • cycleOpenDirection

      public MovementDirection cycleOpenDirection()
      Description copied from class: AbstractStructure
      Cycle the MovementDirection direction this IStructure will open in. By default, it'll set and return the opposite direction of the current direction.

      Note that this does not actually change the open direction; it merely tells you which direction comes next!

      Overrides:
      cycleOpenDirection in class AbstractStructure
      Returns:
      The new MovementDirection direction this IStructure will open in.

    • calculateAnimationCycleDistance

      protected double calculateAnimationCycleDistance()
      Description copied from class: AbstractStructure
      Calculates the distance traveled per animation by the animated block that travels the furthest.

      For example, for a circular object, this will be a block on the edge, as these blocks travel further per revolution than the blocks closer to the center of the circle.

      This method looks at the distance per animation cycle. The exact definition of a cycle depends on the implementation of the structure. For a big door, for example, a cycle could be a single toggle, or a quarter circle. To keep things easy, a revolving structure (which may not have a definitive end to its animation) could define a cycle as quarter circle as well.

      The distance value is used to calculate AbstractStructure.getMinimumAnimationTime() and AbstractStructure.getBaseAnimationTime().

      Specified by:
      calculateAnimationCycleDistance in class AbstractStructure
      Returns:
      The longest distance traveled by an animated block measured in blocks.

    • calculateAnimationRange

      protected Rectangle calculateAnimationRange()
      Description copied from class: AbstractStructure
      Calculates the rectangle describing the limits within an animation of this door takes place.

      At no point during an animation will any animated block leave this cuboid, though not guarantees are given regarding how tight the cuboid fits around the animated blocks.

      Specified by:
      calculateAnimationRange in class AbstractStructure
      Returns:
      The animation range.

    • calculateAnimationRange

      Returns:

    • getMaxRadius

      public static double getMaxRadius(Cuboid cuboid, Vector3Di rotationPoint)
      Calculates the longest possible radius from the rotation point of a big door to another point that is still part of the big door.
      Parameters:
      cuboid - The cuboid that describes this door.
      rotationPoint - The rotation point of the door.
      Returns:
      The radius between the rotation point of the door and the animated block furthest from it.
